instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging/ low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
My second post yay. 
Alright so i have another <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with liquid damage. This machine is confusing. Initially it was 5v 0.05a. So checked <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> and it was 0.7 v. Figured maybe shorted so injected voltage around 1v on f5200, got no power consumption. Plugged it in and then machine booted. As i went down the testing ladder it seems the machine will always attempt to boot make a chine and then reboot and be successful. This will happen each time. Aside from this issue the battery isnt charging. While diagnosing the battery not charging <TRANSISTOR>Q5155</TRANSISTOR> wasn't acting right. After replacing it and connected device. It did the boot and then reboot, charged the battery for a couple of seconds and then the amperage dropped, starting charging and then repeated the same behavior for a 10 seconds and then stopped charging again and hasn't since.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> is 12.01 v after it started working again.

What to do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging/ low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Actually machine still works with charger?
Is the battery recognized at least?

Post <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> voltage level.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging/ low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
The machine does work with a charger. The battery is identified. 1% and says service now. Its has 150 cycles. 
Sys detect is about 3v
Sys detect was about 0.9v
This was checked last night. I will check again and confim

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging/ low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Alright so checked again. This is with only battery connected.
Sys detect 3.7v
Sys detect l - 0v
Last time i checked was right after i replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5155</TRANSISTOR> and it charged for 30 seconds. It has about a 1v on it.

Also checked ppbus aon. 
At one point was 10.35v however the most consistent i can get is starts off at 12.30 then drops to 12.01 reboots. Starts at 12.30 and then stays at 12.01.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging/ low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
As you get "Service Now" message about battery, you should test with known good one.

Battery may still be good, but internally locked by its processor.
In such case, dedicated tool like NLBA1 can solve the problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging/ low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I will test the battery with another board and i have more batteries if this one is actually bad, but i think something else is causing this. What are you're thoughts on the restarts while booting to then successfully boot and ppbus aon being 12.01 v. I will let you know about my battery findings later.
This behavior to me isn't normal. Also to elaborate on when i said the device charged the battery for about 30 secs. It wasn't a consistent charge. The amerpage would go upto 2.4a and the drop to 0.20a and did that multiple times with a 5 sec gap in between and then altogether stopped.
